uveitis_classifications.name: Cytomegalovirus Anterior Uveitis

criteria.type: Evidence of anterior uveitis
details: anterior chamber cells
if anterior vitreous cells are present, anterior chamber inflammation should be present
no evidence of retinitis

criteria.type: Evidence of cytomegalovirus infection in the eye
details: Positive PCR for cytomegalovirus on aqueous specimen

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Aqueous specimen PCR positive for herpes simplex virus or varicella zoster virus

uveitis_classifications.name: Herpes Simplex Anterior Uveitis

criteria.type: Evidence of anterior uveitis
details: anterior chamber cells
if anterior vitreous cells are present, severity is less than anterior chamber inflammation
no evidence of retinitis

criteria.type: Unilateral uveitis
details: unless there is a positive aqueous PCR for herpes simplex virus

criteria.type: Evidence of herpes simplex infection in the eye
details: aqueous humor PCR positive for herpes simplex virus OR
sectoral iris atrophy in a patient <50 years of age OR
herpes simplex keratitis

exclusions: Concomitant dermatomal/cutaneous varicella zoster virus (unless aqueous specimen PCR positive for herpes simplex virus)
Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Aqueous specimen PCR positive for cytomegalovirus or varicella zoster virus

uveitis_classifications.name: Varicella Zoster Virus Anterior Uveitis

criteria.type: Evidence of anterior uveitis
details: anterior chamber cells
if anterior vitreous cells are present, severity is less than anterior chamber inflammation
no evidence of retinitis

criteria.type: Unilateral uveitis
details: unless there is a positive aqueous PCR for varicella zoster virus

criteria.type: Evidence of varicella zoster virus infection in the eye
details: aqueous humor PCR positive for varicella zoster virus OR
sectoral iris atrophy in a patient > 60 years of age OR
concurrent or recent dermatomal Herpes zoster

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Aqueous specimen PCR positive for cytomegalovirus or herpes simplex virus

uveitis_classifications.name: Fuchs Uveitis Syndrome

criteria.type: Evidence of anterior uveitis
details: anterior chamber cells
if vitreous cells are present, anterior chamber inflammation also should be present
no evidence of active retinitis

criteria.type: Unilateral uveitis
Evidence of Fuchs uveitis syndrome
details: heterochromia OR
unilateral diffuse iris atrophy AND stellate keratic precipitates

criteria.type: Neither endotheliitis nor nodular, coin-shaped endothelial lesions

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Aqueous specimen PCR positive for cytomegalovirus, herpes simplex virus or varicella zoster virus

uveitis_classifications.name: Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis-associated Chronic Anterior Uveitis

criteria.type: Evidence of anterior uveitis
details: anterior chamber cells
if anterior vitreous cells are present, severity is less than anterior chamber inflammation

criteria.type: Chronic anterior uveitis or, if at initial diagnosis, uveitis is of insidious onset and asymptomatic/ minimally symptomatic
Juvenile idiopathic arthritis of the following subtypes
details: Oligoarthritis, persistent or extended, OR
Rheumatoid factor negative polyarthritis, OR
Juvenile psoriatic arthritis, other than psoriatic spondylitis

exclusions: Enthesitis-related arthritis
Positive serologic test for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata) or other granulomatous disease
Aqueous specimen PCR positive for cytomegalovirus, herpes simplex virus, or varicella zoster virus

uveitis_classifications.name: Spondyloarthritis/HLA-B27-associated Anterior Uveitis

criteria.type: Evidence of anterior uveitis
details: anterior chamber cells
if anterior vitreous cells are present, severity is less than anterior chamber inflammation

criteria.type: Characteristic uveitis course
details: Acute or recurrent acute, unilateral or unilateral alternating course OR
Chronic course with a history of a recurrent acute, unilateral or unilateral alternating course evolving into chronic course

criteria.type: ASAS-defined spondyloarthritis (axial or peripheral) and/or HLA-B27-positive
Chronic uveitis with both ASAS-defined spondyloarthritis (axial or peripheral) AND HLA-B27-positive

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Aqueous specimen PCR positive for cytomegalovirus, Herpes simplex virus or Varicella zoster virus

uveitis_classifications.name: Tubulointerstitial Nephritis with Uveitis Syndrome

criteria.type: Evidence of anterior uveitis
details: anterior chamber cells
if vitritis or choroiditis or retinal vascular changes are present, anterior chamber inflammation also should be present

criteria.type: Evidence of tubulointerstitial nephritis
details: Positive renal biopsy OR
Elevated urine Î²-microglobulin and either abnormal urine analysis or elevated serum creatinine

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)

uveitis_classifications.name: Multiple Sclerosis-associated Intermediate Uveitis

criteria.type: Evidence of intermediate uveitis
details: vitreous cells AND/OR vitreous haze
if anterior chamber cells are present, anterior chamber inflammation less than vitreous
no evidence of retinitis or choroiditis

criteria.type: Evidence of multiple sclerosis using the Revised McDonald Diagnostic Criteria

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Positive serology for Lyme disease, either IgG or IgM (e.g. positive ELISA AND Western blot with requisite number of bands for assay used)

uveitis_classifications.name: Pars Planitis

criteria.type: Evidence of intermediate uveitis
details: vitreous cells AND/OR vitreous haze
if anterior chamber cells are present, anterior chamber inflammation severity less than vitreous severity
no evidence of retinitis or choroiditis
no retinal vascular occlusion in posterior pole & mid-periphery

criteria.type: Evidence of pars planitis
details: vitreous snowballs OR
pars plana snowbanks

exclusions: Multiple sclerosis, defined by the McDonald criteria
Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Positive serology for Lyme disease, either IgG or IgM (e.g. positive ELISA AND Western blot with requisite number of bands for assay used)

uveitis_classifications.name: Intermediate Uveitis, Non-Pars Planitis Type

criteria.type: Evidence of intermediate uveitis
details: vitreous cells AND/OR vitreous haze
if anterior chamber cells are present, anterior chamber inflammation less than vitreous
no evidence of retinitis

criteria.type: No evidence of pars planitis
details: neither vitreous snowballs NOR
pars plana snowbanks

exclusions: Multiple sclerosis, defined by the McDonald criteria
Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Positive serology for Lyme disease, either IgG or IgM (e.g. positive ELISA AND Western blot with requisite number of bands for assay used)
Evidence of intraocular lymphoma on diagnostic vitrectomy

uveitis_classifications.name: Acute Posterior Multifocal Placoid Pigment Epitheliopathy

criteria.type: Paucifocal or multifocal choroidal lesions on clinical examination
details: Plaque-like or placoid appearance to the lesions

criteria.type: Characteristic fluorescein angiogram in the acute phase of the disease
details: lesions are hypofluorescent early and diffusely hyperfluorescent late

exclusions: Positive serologic test for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)

uveitis_classifications.name: Birdshot Chorioretinitis

criteria.type: Characteristic bilateral multifocal choroiditis on ophthalmoscopy
details: Multifocal cream-colored or yellow-orange, oval or round choroidal lesions ('birdshot spots')

criteria.type: Absent to mild anterior chamber inflammation
details: Absent to mild anterior chamber cells AND
No keratic precipitates AND
No posterior synechiae

criteria.type: Absent to moderate vitritis
Multifocal choroiditis with
details: Positive HLA-A29 test AND either
Characteristic 'birdshot' spots (multifocal cream-colored or yellow-orange, oval or round choroidal lesions) on ophthalmoscopy OR
Characteristic indocyanine green angiogram (multifocal hypofluorescent spots) without characteristic 'birdshot' spots on ophthalmoscopy

exclusions: Positive serologic test for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Evidence of intraocular lymphoma on diagnostic vitrectomy or tissue biopsy

uveitis_classifications.name: Multiple Evanescent White Dot Syndrome

criteria.type: Multifocal chorioretinal gray-white spots with foveal granularity
Characteristic fluorescein angiogram or optical coherence tomogram (OCT)
details: 'Wreath-like' hyperfluorescent lesions on fluorescein angiogram OR
Hyper-reflective lesions on OCT extending from the retinal pigment epithelium, into and/or through the ellipsoid zone into the outer nuclear layer of the retina

criteria.type: Absent to mild anterior chamber and vitreous inflammation

exclusions: Positive serologic test for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Bilateral simultaneous disease onset

uveitis_classifications.name: Multifocal Choroiditis with Panuveitis

criteria.type: Multifocal choroiditis
details: Oval or round lesions
Predominant lesion size >125 Âµm

criteria.type: Characteristic appearance
details: 'Punched-out atrophic' chorioretinal scars OR
Active lesions with more than minimal vitreous inflammation

criteria.type: Inflammatory lesions and/or characteristic scars involving the mid-periphery or periphery with or without posterior pole involvement

exclusions: Positive serologic test for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
In tuberculosis-endemic regions or tuberculosis-exposed individuals, evidence of infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis

uveitis_classifications.name: Punctate Inner Choroiditis

criteria.type: Multifocal choroidal inflammatory lesions
details: Predominant lesion size <250 Âµm
Punctate lesion appearance

criteria.type: Lesion involvement of posterior pole with or without mid-periphery
Absent to minimal anterior chamber and vitreous inflammation

exclusions: Positive serologic test for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)

uveitis_classifications.name: Serpiginous Choroiditis

criteria.type: Paucifocal or multifocal choroiditis with an ameboid or serpentine shape
Characteristic imaging
details: Fluorescein angiogram with early diffuse hypofluorescent lesions and late hyperfluorescent lesion borders OR
Fundus auto-fluorescence with hypo-autofluorescent lesions with hyper-autofluorescent borders

criteria.type: Absent to minimal anterior chamber and vitreous inflammation

exclusions: Positive serologic test for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)
Evidence of infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis

uveitis_classifications.name: BehÃ§et Disease Uveitis

criteria.type: Compatible uveitic syndrome
details: Anterior uveitis
Anterior and intermediate uveitis
Posterior uveitis with retinal vasculitis and/or focal retinal infiltrates
Panuveitis with retinal vasculitis and/or focal retinal infiltrates

criteria.type: A diagnosis of BehÃ§et disease using International Study Group for BehÃ§et Disease criteria

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence for sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)

uveitis_classifications.name: Sarcoidosis-Associated Uveitis

criteria.type: Compatible uveitic picture
details: Anterior uveitis OR
Intermediate or anterior/intermediate uveitis OR
Posterior uveitis with either choroiditis (paucifocal choroidal nodule(s) or multifocal choroiditis) OR
Panuveitis with choroiditis or retinal vascular sheathing or retinal vascular occlusion

criteria.type: Evidence of sarcoidosis
details: Tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata OR
Bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence of infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis

uveitis_classifications.name: Sympathetic Ophthalmia

criteria.type: History of unilateral ocular trauma or surgery
Ocular inflammation
details: Bilateral OR
If there is no view in the inciting eye (e.g. enucleated, phthisis, opaque cornea), then detectable inflammation in the sympathizing eye

criteria.type: Evidence of more than isolated anterior uveitis
details: Anterior chamber and vitreous inflammation OR
Panuveitis with choroidal involvement

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence for sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)

uveitis_classifications.name: Early-Stage Vogt-Koyanagi-Harada Disease

criteria.type: Evidence of Harada's disease
details: Serous (exudative) retinal detachment AND
Multi-loculated appearance on fluorescein angiogram OR
Septae on optical coherence tomogram

criteria.type: Panuveitis with >2 of the following neurologic symptoms or signs
details: Headache OR
Tinnitus OR
Dysacusis OR
Meningismus OR
Cerebrospinal fluid pleocytosis

criteria.type: No history of penetrating ocular trauma or vitreoretinal surgery prior to disease onset

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence for sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)

uveitis_classifications.name: Late-Stage Vogt-Koyanagi-Harada Disease

criteria.type: History of early-stage Vogt-Koyanagi-Harada disease
Sunset glow fundus
Uveitis AND >1 of the following cutaneous findings
details: Vitiligo OR
Poliosis OR
Alopecia

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Evidence for sarcoidosis (either bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging or tissue biopsy demonstrating non-caseating granulomata)

uveitis_classifications.name: Acute Retinal Necrosis Syndrome

criteria.type: Necrotizing retinitis involving the peripheral retina
Evidence of infection with either herpes simplex virus (HSV) or Varicella zoster virus (VZV)
details: Positive PCR for either HSV or VZV from either an aqueous or vitreous specimen

criteria.type: Characteristic clinical picture
details: Circumferential or confluent retinitis AND
Retinal vascular sheathing and/or occlusion AND
More than minimal vitritis

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test

Intraocular specimen PCR-positive for cytomegalovirus or Toxoplasma gondii (unless there is immune compromise, morphologic evidence for >1 infection, the characteristic clinical picture of acute retinal necrosis, and the intraocular fluid specimen has a positive PCR for either HSV or VZV)

uveitis_classifications.name: Cytomegalovirus Retinitis

criteria.type: Necrotizing retinitis with indistinct borders due to numerous small (<50 Î¼m) satellites
Immune compromise
details: Systemic (e.g. AIDS, organ transplant, chemotherapy) OR
Ocular (e.g. intraocular corticosteroids or chemotherapy)

criteria.type: Characteristic clinical picture
details: Wedge-shaped area of retinitis OR
Hemorrhagic appearance of the retinitis OR
Granular appearance of the retinitis AND
Absent to mild vitritis

criteria.type: Evidence of intraocular infection with cytomegalovirus
details: Positive PCR for cytomegalovirus from either the aqueous or vitreous specimen

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test

Intraocular specimen PCR-positive for herpes simplex virus, varicella zoster virus or Toxoplasma gondii (unless there is immune compromise, morphologic evidence for >1 infection, the characteristic picture of cytomegalovirus retinitis, and the intraocular fluid specimen also has a positive PCR for cytomegalovirus)

uveitis_classifications.name: Syphilitic Uveitis

criteria.type: Uveitis with a compatible uveitic presentation
details: Anterior uveitis OR
Intermediate uveitis or anterior/intermediate uveitis OR
Posterior or panuveitis with one of the following presentations
Placoid inflammation of the retinal pigment epithelium or
Multifocal inflammation of the retina/retinal pigment epithelium or
Necrotizing retinitis or
Retinal vasculitis

criteria.type: Evidence of infection with Treponema pallidum
details: Positive treponemal test and non-treponemal test
Positive treponemal test with two different treponemal tests

exclusions: History of adequate treatment for syphilitic uveitis

uveitis_classifications.name: Toxoplasmic Retinitis

criteria.type: Focal or paucifocal necrotizing retinitis
Evidence of infection with Toxoplasma gondii
details: Positive PCR for Toxoplasma gondii from either the aqueous or vitreous specimen OR
Positive serum IgM antibodies against Toxoplasma gondii

criteria.type: Characteristic clinical ocular features
details: Hyperpigmented and/or atrophic chorioretinal scar ('toxoplasmic scar') AND
Round or oval retinitis lesions OR
Recurrent acute (episodic) course

exclusions: Both negative IgG AND IgM antibodies against Toxoplasma gondii (unless there is a positive PCR for Toxoplasma gondii from an aqueous or vitreous specimen)
Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test

Intraocular specimen PCR-positive for herpes simplex virus, varicella zoster virus or cytomegalovirus (unless there is immune compromise, morphologic evidence for >1 infection, the characteristic picture of toxoplasmic retinitis, and the intraocular fluid specimen also has a positive PCR for T. gondii)

uveitis_classifications.name: Tubercular Uveitis

criteria.type: Evidence of a tubercular uveitis compatible uveitic syndrome
details: anterior uveitis with iris nodules
serpiginous-like tubercular choroiditis
choroidal nodule (i.e. tuberculoma)
in individuals with active systemic tuberculosis, multifocal choroiditis
occlusive retinal vasculitis

criteria.type: Evidence of infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis
details: histologically- or microbiologically-confirmed infection with M. tuberculosis OR
positive interferon-Î³ release assay (IGRA) OR
positive tuberculin skin test

exclusions: Positive serology for syphilis using a treponemal test
Positive biopsy for sarcoidosis (and therefore an absence of histological or microbiologic confirmation of infection with M. tuberculosis)

Uveitic syndrome compatible with either sarcoidosis-associated uveitis or tubercular uveitis and bilateral hilar adenopathy on chest imaging without histological or microbiologic confirmation of the diagnosis of infection with M. tuberculosis
